intro: Hibbertia agrestis, commonly known as the bushy hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and showy yellow-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and heathlands. Its leaves are usually alternate and have a rough, hairy texture. Hibbertia agrestis is often found in regions with a Mediterranean climate, thriving in well-drained soils.
